section_title: Patellar Compression Syndrome (Lateral Patellofemoral Impingement) (Evidence: pg no: 12, L549)
names: Lateral retinacular release (Evidence: pg no: 12, L550)
description: Lateral retinacular release for patellar compression syndrome when specific criteria are met (Evidence: pg no: 12, L550-L558)
scope: Treatment of lateral patellofemoral impingement (Evidence: pg no: 12, L549-L560)

documentation: Positive lateral patellar tilt established on imaging (axial view) (Evidence: pg no: 12, L551)
Failure of at least 6 months of conservative management (Evidence: pg no: 12, L552)
Radiographic imaging consistent with Kellgren-Lawrence grade 2 or lower patellofemoral osteoarthritis (Evidence: pg no: 12, L553)

At least ONE of the following: Positive patella glide test, Positive patella tilt test, or Lateral femoral trochlear or lateral patella facet cartilage lesion confirmed by imaging (Evidence: pg no: 12, L554-L558)

exclusions: Central or medial tracking of the patella (Evidence: pg no: 12, L560)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with lateral release (Evidence: pg no: 16, L701)
Lateral retinacular release, open (Evidence: pg no: 16, L693)
